That said, I was able to unlock all fighters today.What I didn't like - World of Light. I did unlock 19 fighters this way (20 if one includes Mii Swordsman) but the very first legend spirit I came across (specifically M. Bison) felt almost impossible so I gave up and would never touch adventure mode again.
title: I am liking the game thus far.

author: Ebot Ogork
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: Been playing Smash since Melee came out and I have to say it's easily the best fighting gaming series out there. The director, Sakurai, never disappoints and I undoubtedly say Ultimate is the best in the series so far. It has almost everything a Smash fan can ask for and plenty to do to keep you busy on the game for hours upon hours. It has the biggest roster to date in the series and they're still adding more and balancing them out. Only thing the game is missing is more cutscenes and character interactions in its story mode and I'm disappointed that Waluigi isn't playable in it (AGAIN) but I'm hopeful Sakurai might troll us all like he always does and make Waluigi the last DLC character. Other than those 2 things, it's a near flawless game. 9/10.
title: The Best Smash Yet!

author: Brandon Bothell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_content: It's Smash that's portable, that includes every character ever included in a Smash game and has good physics (coming from someone who's last Smash was Brawl). The online has a few issues, but I stick to playing with friends in private online matches anyway so I don't really encounter many of those problems.
title: Amazing

author: Islandcollector88
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
review_content: If you never played a smash bros game, this would be the best time to get this game, it has everyone from past smash bros games, with a few new characters and really good amount of stages. I play this game with my 5 year old nephew and he loves it, I just love to sit with him and play for hours unlocking new characters, the memories this game makes in itself is well worth it and something money can't buy.
title: Just Plain old fun

author: Samus Aran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_content: DOnt really care for all the other characters or online dont even play the switch online any way only one reason why i get super smash bros is my beloved samus aran crazy for her got everthing for switch samus aran skins controller stickers cases posters figures amiibos shirts custom made jackets helmets everything possible did i mention im a really big big big fan of samus aran oh yea i did and yes thats why i buy smash bros only for her and this game playing on tv or car i can go with her every were lol 5 star and got my copy yesterday from amazon thanks
title: samus aran

author: Alex Herrera
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2018
review_content: Super smash bros ultimate is one of the best smash bros ive played. I threw two parties this weekend and everybody had tons of fun playing it to where two of my friends are going to buy a switch just for this game. There is a lot of new stuff like characters maps spirits and game modes. A con for former smash bros players is that its going to feel repetitive because at the end of the day you use the same character you always use on your favorite map. But for new people it is a must have.
title: Tons of fun

author: Steven Murdock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2018
review_content: First Smash game I’ve played since the N64 one. There are a lot of hidden mechanics and things to master in this game. A lot of the reviews on Amazon are so harsh it’s actually funny. I really am enjoying this and am learning how to master aspects of it all the time. Great to play with other people online and on the couch!
title: Love it!

author: C.A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_content: This game is amazing! If you own a switch and enjoy fighting games then you need this one! I consider it to be a must have switch game right alongside breath of the wild, splatoon 2 and Mario odyssey!I haven't been able to put it down for long since receiving it.
title: Amazing, another switch classic!

author: Joe C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_content: Great game! Haven’t played since N64 edition. Brings back great memories.FYI N64 controllers can take more abuse. If you are losing Switch controllers can’t handle throwing. If you flick it. Towards a pillow/couch a few times you are safe. Throw with a floor skip and walk smash not so much.
title: GREAT GAME!

author: Evan Robinson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2021
review_content: First time, using nintendo online + smash. Brawlhalla is free and online is free and it works perfectly. Smash costs money and you have to pay to use the servers. So it will work fine, right? No, I can barely play with my friends. Online battle arena with my friends run at 5 frames a second, or less for 80% of the time. Literally unplayable. Maybe other people are fine with it but its not really acceptable imo. Game is good, servers ruin it.
title: Great fun playing with friends in 5 frames a second.

author: Adan Sotelo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019
review_content: Even in a year with games such as God of War, Spider-Man, and Read Dead Redemption 2 this was still my most anticipated game of the year. It has met all of my expectations for a Smash game, and I would recommend it to any fan of the series. The game has every character ever in a Smash game, over 100 stages, and also looks beautiful. Smash Ultimate plays a lot faster than Brawl or WiiU/3DS, but not as fast as Melee. It is a great middle ground for fans of the series. The only downside right  now is the state of the online infrastructure. Many games can be laggy when playing online, especially in 4 player matches as one player's bad internet connection can hinder the experience for the rest of the players. This, however, has not detracted from my personal enjoyment of the game as I generally play with friends in-person, but if you plan to play online a lot I would keep the current sub-par online experience in mind.
title: Best Smash Bros. Ever!

author: C. Kay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
review_content: I gifted my daughter Smash Bro’s as an early Christmas present. We realized our switch was stolen. We held each other and cried.She lost all her game play in Zelda and I’m not going to spend Christmas break playing smash bros with my girl.😭.
title: Someone stole our switch.

author: Justin T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
review_content: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is another great addition to one of the most successful video game franchises in history!As someone who has not played a Smash game regularly since Melee, I can say that this game is very accessible to newcomers.  Just prepare to be dominated in online matches until you put in quite a number of hours of training and learning how your favorite characters play.  The roster is very diverse and ensures that everyone can find a character they enjoy playing as in addition to the DLC characters that come out.  If you have a Nintendo Switch and you haven't bought this game, what are you doing?
title: Masahiro Sakurai's best work to date!

author: FRANCISCO MARQUEZ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
review_content: My kids love it !!! Excellent game for Nintendo Switch !!!
title: Excellent game for Nintendo Switch !!!

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
review_content: Sakurai is loved for this series. And players should see why once they've experienced the flood of content in this game.Competitive and DLC packs seem to be where their effort is right now. Online is an improvement, but is still not enjoyable for most people due to input delay.The CPUs are less BS to fight while also being much more savage with edge guarding and meteors. (Previous CPUs in Smash 4 had perfect responses with inhuman execution allowing for perfect dodges & frame perfect moves to trump player input at the instance)Just pick this up. You don't need to read reviews for Smash games.
title: Fantastic game. Worth picking up again.

author: SteveWithAnS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_content: The game is great and reminds me of previous versions, but it has much better graphics, performance and responsiveness than previous versions.  The amount of levels and characters with unique traits and moves is astounding.  The music and sound effects are also great and all of the positive attributes of this game make it addicting to play.  I will be playing this on the train to work for a long time.
title: Fantastic Game!

author: Brandon Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
review_content: I've always loved playing the Smash Bros series but this game is so much more. I started playing Smash Bros Ultimate as soon as it came in, since then my girlfriend left me (because I forgot I had one), my cat ran out of food and started eating my legs because he thought I had died, and I almost passed out because of a horrible smell in my house but came to realize that that smell was me. On the bright side, I have lost a few pounds because I haven't eaten in over a week now. Please send help!
title: Your life will be over...

author: Raven
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2021
review_content: Sure, the game is filled with dozens of characters, has great graphics and even a decent online platform. My biggest issue comes from the Spirit Adventure mode. Let's be completely honest, this is a part of the game that will give even the most zen gamer rage issues as most of the fights you have are near impossible odds. Not the best game for completionists. Many of the people online also ruin the experience by spamming (Ness and Lucas mainers im looking at you specifically) needs to have a function where you can block certain characters in the 'create rules' function as well as a block function so you don't have to deal with playing spammers over and over again. Other than that, its not bad.
title: Be warned

author: iPawl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2019
review_content: This is a much much better game than smash 4, it’s almost like melee but more refined. It’s a faster pace game than brawl was and smash 4. The amount of characters to choose from in this game is one of part of the game and every character seems like reasonably balanced, there are a few exceptions now and there but that’s to be expected. There is no such thing as perfect, at least in my opinion, but this iteration of smash is as close to it as any of the ones before it.
title: Brings back many memories

author: Ana Karen Martinez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2019
review_content: Tuve problemas con el producto ya que la primera vez que lo recibí el juego no estaba adentro del empaque sellado, sin embargo hice el reclamo y me enviaron al instante un reemplazo. Es un excelente juego, con muy buenos gráficos y un concepto nuevo del viejo smash
title: Feliz

author: Eric M. Harris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018
review_content: If you've played a Smash Bros game then you know what to expect.  This version has more characters than ever, with all the characters who have ever been playable in Smash coming back.  Nearly all the stages are back as well, and tons of music too.  Smash Ultimate plays a bit more quick than the 3DS/WiiU versions did, making the game more fast paced in general.Lots of stuff to unlock, and just so much fun to play with friends.  The online component is a bit iffy at times, but it's been improving.
title: Everyone is here!

author: Melissa Renee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
review_content: Has all of the nostalgia of the old game, but with all the new flare!New characters, moves, and a great story mode.I like the idea of physical cartridges for if you want to swap games with friends/relatives, and they’re less storage on your console. The digital downloads are nice too though for if you want to navigate to different games without having to get up and switch out your game.
title: I will always love Smash Bros

author: KJESPOKO
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: This game is so fun! My kids love it and have enjoyed playing the game and unlocking more characters. I can also say that it has caused some contention around our household, but the game encourages you to get better. My 5 year old couldn't help but call it Smusher Smash, so that is the name it is know as around our household.Fun game play and very enjoyable.
title: "Smusher Smash" is the best

author: Ricardo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018
review_content: What more could be said? It's pretty much the ultimate version of Smash bros. Tons of characters to unlock, an amazing adventure mode featuring spirits we know and love. Plus, classic mode! Do you have what it takes to reach the end?As for the online some have had good experiences some bad. You know how it goes first few days of a game?Overall if your looking for a good time with your friends/family nothing beats grabbing the joycons or gamecube controller and having a blast.
title: Its a matter of fact! Smash is back!!!!

author: Sattirdae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021
review_content: I bought this game because Berleezy plays it and is good at it and now I'm hooked. This game is way too good. I hate that Nintendo forces you to pay for online play of any game even though you already own the console and the games and your own ISP. I hate it but they're in their bag. I get it
title: Addictive!

author: Jared
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019
review_content: Story mode was a solid 20 hours or so of gameplay and I loved every bit of it. You start out as Kirby and then get to battle and win every character. There are way more than in other games and a lot of fun moves to discover.A couple of the dungeons were confusing and took a glance on the Google to figure out but eventually got them completed.Overall one of my favorite switch games and would highly recommend!
title: Seriously amazing game!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: My son worked hard to earn money to purchase this game so you can imagine his disappointment when he took the packaging off and opened the case to see that there was NO game card in it! I called Nintendo and spent close to an hour being put on hold. I am a busy single mom of two young boys and so I have elected to replace it through Amazon. But I have read online of numerous accounts of this happening to others. Nintendo will say that they measure the case prior to shipping but others have said the weight difference is insignificant. Nintendo needs to be made aware of this ongoing issue. Honest people are being scammed. I hope the replacement game has the actual card in it. I'll update my review on our results.
title: Missing game card

author: Christian Montoya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2018
review_content: I've played every single smash game since the n64. This is the best one yet. It combines the best of Melee, Brawl & Smash for Wii U. The single player mode is amazing on its own. Online is great as long as you have an ethernet adapter and you play with wireless controllers. I actually ended up settling on the Pro Controller which is working well for me, which is surprising because I was certain I would want to use the Gamecube controller & adapter. YMMV. But if you've been on the fence about this, GET THIS GAME.
title: Just an excellent game

author: Zac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021
review_content: I really enjoy this game and recommend it. It's not the gameplay that I am upset about. I bought this game on April 29 of 2021. It stopped working within a couple of months. When I insert the game , we get a message saying there is no game inserted. All of my other games work fine, so it's not my console.I would be very careful when buying used since it can be economical. However, if your game stops working shortly after buying it, it's a waste.
title: Defective Copy

author: Christopher A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
review_content: For those unfamiliar with Smash Bros: This is a fantastic game for people of all ages. You can take control of characters from many of Nintendo's iconic game franchises, such as Super Mario Bros., The Legend of Zelda, Star Fox, Metroid, Donkey Kong Country, Animal Crossing, and more, with some guests from Sega, Capcom, Square Enix, Konami, and even Namco's Pac-Man. This game is designed so you mostly play against each other, but there's nothing wrong with pairing up and facing computer opponents or real people over the internet in team battles. You already have enough controllers for two because of the two Joycons that come with the Nintendo Switch, but for a more comfortable option, there's a full pair of Joycons, the Switch Pro Controller, and the Nintendo Gamecube Controller, but you need the Gamecube Controller Adapter to use those. A Must Have for the system, whether for children or adults.For Non-Casuals: Fantastic. This game feels incredible. There's a certain swiftness and power in this game that I didn't feel in Smash 4. First of all. Look at the UI. It is streamlined and kind of gives off that competitive feel. Characters KO faster and most, if not all characters that I know of , have kill-confirms, so you have a certified option to defeat your opponent. Online is on the weak side. For me, an ethernet adapter made a difference, but if your opponent has a bad connection, you will. Hopefully, Nintendo will improve the game's netcode. Just get it. It's GREAT.
title: The Lovechild of Melee and Smash 4.

author: Steven
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019
review_content: I've been playing Smash since the first one. I was pretty close to pro level in Brawl (I know it's not great, you don't need to tell me). This one is absolutely incredible. The mechanics have been tweaked enough to differentiate it from Smash 4. The character roster is absolutely insane. WOLF IS BACK!!!! Their are only two negatives here: 1) The mini games (break the targets, board the platforms, home run contest, etc.) are gone 2) World of Light is pretty meh.This is a must have for any Nintendo Switch owner.
title: Best Super Smash Bros.

author: S Crow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2019
review_content: You will start with one fighter, and your goal is to bring balance to light and dark.  Along the way you will gain spirits which will give you perks in battle.  Having the right spirit in a battle can make a big difference.  There can be up to 3 different endings in the game.  There is an optional tutorial if you want to take it.  This is a rather basic fighting game and is very easy to pick up.  I am not a fan of fighting games, and found this game alot of fun.
title: Super Fun Game

author: Michelle Wightman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021
review_content: It is a game I purchased in hopes that my daughter and I could play it and have fun however the difficulty level for me as an adult is beyond comprehension.. it has seriously just been sitting with the other games with less than 5hours of playing time because I couldn’t understand how to do anything
title: Disappointing

author: Sainijon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018
review_content: Amazing game, easily the best of the series thus far. Lots of characters to choose from, with lots of stages to battle on. While it might take a while to unlock all the characters, it was still fun to see who would show up next. The new story mode, while fun, was a little too difficult for me at times, and I went about unlocking characters the old fashioned way. As for controls, the usual Smash rules from Melee onwards are still the norm and as a result the GameCube controller is the best way to play competitively.
title: Lots of characters, stages and battles to be had.

author: Mark Mishkin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018
review_content: I never played Smash Bros that much before and I decided to pre order this game. However, even if it's very hard there are guides on YouTube and customization with controls for your liking to make it easier to play. I am still struggling to fight against the CPU players. However, for me personally it's a great experience so far. If you look at the game as a whole it was what I actually expected for the price and content. However, if it gets too frustrating to play I might update this review but overall I love playing Smash Ultimate.
title: Great game but very difficult for beginners.

author: David McCahon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2019
review_content: The game is amazing, from the maps to the vast amount of fighters there is no shortage of content. The graphics are great and the world of light mode is a lot of fun. The game also is given a constant stream of support and events. There are so many small things to appreciate, such as the ability to change the menu music to the N64 version. The multiplayer does need some work in my opinion, but it is still great.P.S. WHERE IS WALUIGI?!?!
title: What do you need to say this is the Ultimate Smash!

author: Jacob C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018
review_content: Over the course of this weekend, I've put an embarrassing number of hours into this game and it really is Ultimate. It's fast and responsive, the new modes and customization options allow for playing just the way you want, the Adventure mode is a pleasant surprise--fun and interesting--and being able to play it on the go is just incredible. Minor elements are missing from previous games, but the really core important things are here and improved upon in every way.Note: I have heard a lot of negative feedback about the online experience; I personally don't play it so I'm unconcerned and also optimistic that issues will likely improve or be patched over time. Time will tell, but this is not a significant concern for me.
title: Just a lot of fun for a Smash fan

author: Master Blaster 727
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
review_content: Super Smash brings the whole family together  in a knockdown drag out fight & that's even before anyone gets a controller! But seriously this is a great game, had a 30 yr old, 20 yr old, 14 yr old, & a 7 yr old all playing at the same time (all were actively engaged & away from their cellphones). An absolute must if you have a Nintendo Switch!!!
title: All family squabbles are started & finished here!!!

author: Don
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: This is a great game, with a lot of fun.But it is not an easy game.I am pretty good at fighting game, such as KOF and Dragon ball Z fighter. But this game gives me some hard time on the adventure. Any battle that higher than 3 star is really hard and pain.Again, I am new player to this game. Pretty sure it can get better once I pritice more.All I am saying is be ready, don’t expect an easy family game. It is really not that low.
title: I am a new player, here is what I thought...

author: Sarah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021
review_content: I played the game with my boyfriend. We both spent 70 hours in it so far and have only finished the adventure. The game itself is beautiful and its performance is great. No lags whatsoever. It is a lot of fun and can be challenging.We personally felt like we have to figure out a lot by ourselves (what purpose have items, spirits, dojos, etc.) however we really had a good time playing it and are still going back every now and then. For a fighting game it is very unique. I would recommend not to give up too soon, because it is really fun.
title: Love the game

author: Tom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2018
review_content: I am most likely less than 1% of the buy experience, but caution of Super Smash replicas. I had initially thought that it was the actual Super Smash Bros. Ultimate but after further inspection by putting in the switch and the game cartridge itself, it turned out to be fake (I received a $15 game). Everything was imitated with a paper cover and also paper on the game itself. I was actually excited to receive this product (would have gave a 5) but the 1 star is just for my personal experience.
title: Buyer Beware: False Copies

author: crossingborders
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_content: I'm writing this review on behalf of my teenage son, who ordered this game. When I asked him what he thought of the game, he said," It's a beautiful game." I honestly have never heard that said of a game before and I had to laugh. But he takes his videogaming seriously. He loves this new version of Super Smash Brothers and has even set up a tournament with his friends with a Super Smash Brothers Ultimate game as the prize for the winner.
title: It's a beautiful game.

author: Uhila
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2019
review_content: All I ever wanted out of a Smash game. Beautiful graphics. Strong mechanics. Lots to do. My wife and I are well over 100 hours into this game (most of that was spent brawling it out against each other while earning characters) and we are not even close to burnt out. Worth buying a switch just for this game? Yes. There are plenty of other titles that make the switch worth every penny, but this one is the MOAB of this system. (MOAB- an acronym for the United States military ordinance entitled “Mother of all Bombs.”)
title: MOAB

author: Daniel Aguilar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018
review_content: Next to BOTW, I think this is next best game in the entire Switch collection.Spirit mode is a great addition to the game. It takes a while to complete and it's not all that easy. It gets a little repetitive but still good.The fact that you can also play with up to 8 players on the same console is great. I really value being able to play with your friends in the same room. Most other companies/games force themselves to allow another player besides you in split screen, smh.Online is really fun and competitive. Although, I don't play it much. There's a lot to be worked on. EXTREMELY laggy at times which makes it a bad experience. When it actually is working, it's pretty fun. With some updates, I'm sure this will be fixed.Overall a really solid game to play with friends with a lot of things you could do on your own.
title: Solid Game

author: Ashley Willner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2019
review_content: Multi-player online is unplayable because it uses p2p instead of dedicated servers. No plans to fix this, everyone accepts this issue and still gives the game 5 stars. Don't advertise online multi-player if there isn't a playable online multi-player.
title: No playable online system.

author: Mr. Jack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
review_content: I love the faster pace of this game and the single player is very addicting. I was slightly disappointed that subspace emissary didn't make a return but world of light is still great. I am surprised by how addicting it is to collect spirits and create op combos and teams. It is very satisfying to beat a legendary spirit and i like the new classic mode (although i do wish there was a way to randomize who you are going to face and a different bonus stage would've been much appreciated. The online is still a little laggy but its miles ahead of what it used to be and is actually quite playable. Lack of dedicated party system is disappointing but not unexpected from Nintendo since they always seem to lag behind their competitors in terms of multiplayer. Overall this is a great game and the best smash game since melee.
title: Best mechanics since melee coupled with the best singleplayer since brawl

author: I don’t know what I expected to happen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
review_content: Great for all ages! Packed with nostalgia and good old fashion character vs. character fighting. My boyfriend and I play for hours and when we take it places, it’s the life of the party. Probably the first game I didn’t feel guilty paying $70 bucks for. If you’re a Nintendo fan at all, you’ll be happy you made the investment.
title: Why haven’t you bought this yet?!

author: Kinsey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2019
review_content: Opened my SEALED copy and discovered there was no game cartridge included.  Absolutely mental that this is even a possibility.  Looking at the reviews, this isn't even that uncommon.  Unbelievable.
title: Missing Game Cartridge

author: Kevin O'Connor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2019
review_content: My son is enjoying the game, FWIW. But I hate Nintendo. Why do I have 7 different kinds of accounts, and I could not download this title until I straighted them out. Also, now we need a monthly subscription account to play core elements of the game that I already bought? Thanks Nintendo.
title: Hate Nintendo, but kids love the game.

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2019
review_content: Still miserably balanced from Wii U, didn't fix anything that needed to be fixed. Adding more characters was the last thing it needed because it's now even worse, trimming the fat and making a better game was the missing improvement and they moved in the opposite direction. Don't commit a lot of time to it.The release of Joker shows that this is going to be another pay to win game like Smash 4.
title: Imbalanced mess, pay to win DLC

author: Richard Rohr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021
review_content: I've been a loyal amazon customer for quite a few years, but never have I received an item that was already opened to find there was nothing inside! Was planning a gew together with a couple of friends for our birthday to get some smash on, just to find out I received the empty game case and damaged controller boxes! Here's to hoping for a seamless return order..
title: I hope amazon employees actually check returned merchandise..

author: M. Camberos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2018
review_content: Pre ordered a month in advance, while everyone got to play on opening day I had to wait 5 days later
title: Pre ordered

author: charlytoast
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021
review_content: Remember going to your friend's house after school and battling on the GameCube against your friends? This is exactly the same. It aged like fine wine and brings me so much joy. I had to have it. I play it obsessively. Enjoy it as much as I do.
title: Best Game Ever

author: andrzej raczynski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018

author: RG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
review_content: Definitely one of my favorite Switch games! Co-Op in Battle Arena needs to included in an update because playing co-op online shouldn't just be obligated to Quick Plays. Other than that and the online matchmaking itself, playing locally is great and the World of Light adventure mode is pretty cool!
title: Great Smash Bros. game! Just needs to add/update certain things.

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018
review_content: It's the next Smash Bros. game. It's beautiful and amazing and very well done. Creating rules and picking stages becomes 10x easier. A new adventure mode has been introduced. All around an amazing game!Online though is currently in a bad place. There is no standard ruleset anymore. If you are trying to play online in a competitive sense, you may as well give up. You have a *PREFERRED RULESET*. This means that the game will attempt to match you up with players with a similar ruleset. So if you wanted to do a 1v1 with 3 stocks, no items, and on battlefield then you would put that in your preferred ruleset. However you could be placed in a FFA, items, and 5 stocks, 2 minute time limit. Here's hoping online changes!
title: Online stinks at the moment. But an amazing improvement!
